items.headline: US Futures Rise Ahead of Key Jobs Report, Fed Rate Cut Bets Drive Sentiment
items.summary: US stock futures are trading higher this Wednesday morning as investors await the delayed January jobs report. While weak labor market data is anticipated, rising expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut in the first half of 2026 are bolstering market sentiment. Globally, Asian markets showed optimism, with Indian equities also expecting a positive but cautious trading day. Concerns around the impact of AI on financial firms and softer consumer data from Tuesday are tempering broader enthusiasm, even as the Dow closed at another record high yesterday.

items.headline: Datadog Soars on Strong Q4 Revenue Beat
items.summary: Datadog ($DDOG) saw a significant increase of over +15% after reporting Q4 revenue of $953.2 million, surpassing the consensus estimate of $917.2 million.

items.headline: Credo Technology Group Holdings Up on Strong Q3 Revenue Forecast
items.summary: Credo Technology Group Holding Ltd ($CRDO) gained over +10% after providing a preliminary Q3 revenue forecast of $404 million to $408 million, well above the consensus of $341.2 million.

items.headline: Masco Rises on Bullish Full-Year EPS Forecast
items.summary: Masco ($MAS) climbed over +9% after forecasting full-year adjusted EPS of $4.10 to $4.30, with the midpoint exceeding the consensus of $4.19.

items.headline: Amentum Holdings Drops on Q1 Revenue Miss
items.summary: Amentum Holdings ($AMTM) fell over -12% after reporting Q1 revenue of $3.24 billion, which was below the consensus estimate of $3.32 billion.

items.headline: S&P Global Inc. Leads Losers on Weak EPS Forecast
items.summary: S&P Global Inc ($SPGI) declined over -9% after forecasting full-year adjusted EPS of $19.40 to $19.65, weaker than the consensus of $20.00.

items.headline: Incyte Falls Following Dull Full-Year Revenue Forecast
items.summary: Incyte ($INCY) dropped over -8% after forecasting full-year total net product revenue of $4.77 billion to $4.94 billion, with the midpoint below the consensus of $4.87 billion.

items.headline: Delayed January Jobs Report in Focus Today
items.summary: The highly anticipated January jobs report, including nonfarm payrolls, unemployment rate, and average hourly earnings, is scheduled for release today. Wall Street anticipates modest job growth of approximately 55,000 new jobs. Economists forecast a 3.6% year-over-year rise in average hourly earnings and the unemployment rate to hold steady at 4.4%.

items.headline: China Releases January Inflation Data
items.summary: China's National Bureau of Statistics is publishing January 2026 consumer price index (CPI) and producer price index (PPI) data today. Forecasts suggest a modest rise in headline consumer inflation (0.6%-1.2% year-on-year) driven by seasonal Lunar New Year effects, while producer prices are expected to continue showing deflationary pressure.

items.headline: Fed Officials Urge Patience on Rate Cuts Amid Mixed Signals
items.summary: Despite rising bets on an H1 2026 Fed rate cut, recent comments from Federal Reserve officials suggest a cautious approach. Cleveland Fed President Beth Hammack expressed a preference for 'patience' in assessing the impact of recent rate reductions, while Dallas Fed President Lorie Logan indicated that 'material' weakness in the labor market would be necessary to support further rate cuts.

items.headline: Over 290 Companies Report Q3 2026 Earnings Today
items.summary: The Q3 2026 earnings season reaches a decisive phase today with over 290 companies scheduled to announce their December quarter results. Notable companies reporting include Mahindra & Mahindra ($M&M), Divi's Laboratories, Ashok Leyland, LG Electronics, Max Financial Services, and SJVN. Earnings announcements are currently a key driver for market sentiment.

items.headline: Ahold Delhaize Reports Strong Q4 2025 Financial Results
items.summary: International food retail group Ahold Delhaize ($AD) announced robust Q4 2025 financial results, with IFRS operating income reaching €899 million and diluted earnings per share (EPS) at €0.65. The company highlighted its priorities and outlook for 2026, underpinning its value creation and progress towards its 'Growing Together' ambitions.

items.headline: Siemens Energy Posts Strong Q1 FY 2026 Results Driven by Record Orders
items.summary: Siemens Energy ($SIEG.DE) has started its financial year strongly, reporting record orders in Q1 FY 2026. The company saw significant improvements in revenue and cash flow, with earnings more than doubling compared to the previous year. This performance is attributed to sustained high demand in its gas turbines and grid technologies, alongside early signs of improvement in the wind business.

items.headline: AI Tax-Planning Tool Sparks Concerns for Financial Firms
items.summary: Concerns regarding the impact of Artificial Intelligence on financial firms are emerging, with platform Altruist having launched an AI tax-planning tool. This development led to a decline in several finance stocks, notably LPL Financial, which plunged 8.3% on Tuesday, as the threat of automated competition spooked traders.
